intro: Hedeoma hispida, commonly known as rough hedeoma, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and spikes of small, tubular flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and sagebrush steppe. Hedeoma hispida is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally by Native American tribes.
